storePreviousOnPreset.name: Store Rollback when Loading Preset
storePreviousOnPreset.hint: When this value is enabled, a rollback will be created when activating a preset or when importing a preset

keepPresetsRollbacks.name: Number of Rollbacks to keep?
keepPresetsRollbacks.hint: This setting indicates the number of module rollbacks you can do between 0 and 10. If this value is set to 0, it will keep an infinite number of rollbacks. It is suggested not to do this as it will cause bloated data.

showNewChangelogsOnLoad.name: Show New Changelogs on Load
showNewChangelogsOnLoad.hint: If a changelog is marked as unseen and this setting is enabled a dialog will appear showing all changelogs that haven't been marked as seen.

bigPictureMode.name: Big Picture Mode
bigPictureMode.hint: Enabling this feature will set the Module Management and Configure Settings windows to the full height of the foundry window.

showActiveModules.name: Show Active Modules
showActiveModules.hint: When enabled this will show a list of active modules in the settings tab of the sidebar.

disableSyncPrompt.name: Disable Prompt when Syncing Settings
disableSyncPrompt.hint: This will prevent users from getting a notification asking them to confirm if a setting should be synced or not. Instead it will force the setting with no prompt.

autoPrefixModules.name: Auto Prefix Modules
autoPrefixModules.hint: This will prefix the modules title with any required module titles.

smartLabels.name: Smart Labels
smartLabels.hint: When enabled this will prefix modules with an arrow icon, to indicate that it is grouped with the module(s) above it. Hovering over this icon will show all required Modules.

smartPrefix.name: Smart Prefix
smartPrefix.hint: This attempts to prefix titles based on what it thinks is best. For example modules with the library flag will be prefixed with Library, and modules with the word UI in the title will be prefixed with UI. This may not correctly prefix modules, you can override the prefix by right clicking and assigning an override name.

dependencyDialogType.name: Dialog Type for Extended Module Dependencies
dependencyDialogType.hint: This allows you to choose the type of dialog that will be used when enabling/disabling modules using Extended Module Dependencies.

dependencies.headerTextEnable: {title} has {number} inactive dependencies which may no longer be required. They are listed below.
dependencies.headerTextDisable: {title} has {number} active dependencies which may no longer be required. They are listed below.

buttons.deactivateModulesAlt: Hold ctrl to Disable All Modules

syncSetting.askPermission: Allow Your Game master to set the following setting for you?
syncSetting.sendToAll: Send this setting to all other users?

update.description: Update this Preset to the following Modules?

delete.description: Are you sure you want to delete the preset labeled {name}?

activate.description: This preset will enable the following Modules?

notification.copied: Active Module List has been Copied to Your Clipboard!

tidyUI.title: Import Type is TidyUI
tidyUI.message: When importing a TidyUI file you will be unable to import Client or World level settings.

cssTidyMMW.name: Tidy Module Management Window
cssTidyMMW.hint: This stylesheet is designed to give the Module Management Window a more modern and cleaner look.

cssTidyMMWAltCheckbox.name: Alternative Checkbox Style
cssTidyMMWAltCheckbox.hint: This will give the checkbox a cleaner more modern style in Mouse0270 personal opinion.

v214.smartLabels: Migrating Auto Prefix Modules to Smart Labels. This will set Smart Labels to your previous Auto Prefix setting. You can change this settings in the settings window.
